result.execSummary:
The defendant Markola I. WILLIAMS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 02-19-15 at 1:30 p.m.
At 3:02 p.m., $1,000.00 reocognizance bond signed and defendant released from custody.

Stipulation and Order to Amend Criminal Bond.
It is hereby ordered that Mr. William's bail bond in this matter be amended as follows.  The cash bond in the amount of $1,000.00 is to be converted to a signature bond in the amount of $1,000.00 and is ordered to notify the clerk of courts address of his current address upon his release from custody.  All other conditions of Mr. William's bond are to remain in effect.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 11-12-14 at 3:15 p.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts bail jumping, strangulation and suffocation, battery-DVO, disorderly conduct- DVO and resist officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 11-10-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 cash with the conditions that he provide an address, in writing, to the clerk of court office within 24 hours of release and that he have no contact with Cassandra Nenahlo, her residence at 513 N. 41st Street, Manitowoc, WI, her employer Manitowoc Tool and Machine or her children, GNN, DOB: 03-17-2006 and ACN, DOB 04-03-2009. Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.

RE:  Bail jumping, on 11-06-14.
